course.subject: IELM
course.name: Product Design
course.description: Fundamentals of product design from an industrial engineering perspective, including market research and communication, process design and evaluation, design for manufacturability/assembly, design for usability and safety, aesthetics design, and design for reuse. Methods and theories of design and case studies are presented.

reviews.author: Parry CHAN
reviews.title: Course Review for IELM 2150
reviews.comment_content:
This course consists of lectures and labs, with several projects and one Final Examination. This course introduces the fundamentals of product design from the perspective of
industrial engineering, including market research, process design, aesthetics, and design for manufacturability/assembly/usability. Methods and theories of design are introduced and several design examples and case studies will be presented. Students are encouraged to think about new product ideas that have industrial potential.
reviews.comment_teaching: Better to do some reading assignments, as well as preview the lecture notes before the class, so as to get more understanding on the courses and the labs. This will be very helpful for you to get a higher grade.
reviews.comment_grading: Grade is not that bad, in fact. The most important thing is to try your best to do the task, although you may not be able to complete it, when the Professor and TAs see your improvements, then it's good enough.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is comparatively a bit higher than other Level 2 courses, but I did find joyfulness and happiness when attending this class.

reviews.author: potat0
reviews.comment_content:
Covers a wide range of topics but not much depth is given: with only the lecture notes you won't learn much.
LECTURE
- Design methodology and identifying customer needs
- Design specifications
- Visual effects
- Aesthetics in design
- CAD/CAM and 3D printing
- Prototyping
- Design for X
- Market positioning
LAB
- Sketching principles
- Processing (it's a software)
- Rhinoceros (it's a software)
- free project time.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Pros: The professor creates a good atmosphere in class. Good English, isn't boring and listening to the lecture is easy  and interesting (listening will also save you a lot of work).

Cons: prof is a bit lazy:Lecture notes are messy and he isn't very specific about what he wants until the deadline approaches. He has high expectations as of the effort you need to put in.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair and focuses more on assignments and project than the midterm. To do well in this course however, you must continuously put in effort.

- Midterm 30% (only covers the first 3-4 lectures)
- Labs and assignments (10%)
- Sketchbook 20%
- Project 30%
- Participation (PRS) 10%

Grading of lab assignments is a bit random: depends on the TA's definition of creativity . . .
All in all, I would recommend to do your best in the midterm and especially the project report  and you'll get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
High:
- in the first 5 weeks, there are weekly homework and lab submissions
- after the project starts there won't be any more assignments and you don't really have to study anything (no final) but the project requires a lot of work:
- CAD file
- functional physical prototype(s)
~ 20 pages report (if you include all the required sections)
- presentation
only pro: No need to study after midterm, just listening in class will do.

reviews.author: vvv
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is rather intriguing. It is very broad and covers such things as programming, 3D modelling, design from different perspectives (business, mechanics, quality).
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Ravi is a very nice teacher, as he doesn't really want students to learn stuff by heart, but understand what they're doing. But most of the time he cannot finish lectures on time, which means that we have to do it by ourselves. TA's are willing to help all the time, but sometimes they are not really able to.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is pretty nice. You don't have any exams, but that means you have to perform well on labs and the presentation. Even though you may not have good grades in labs, you have to try as much as you can, so that the professor can see the improvements.
reviews.comment_workload: The labs were quite challenging, as it went from 0 to 100 very quickly. But on the whole, you don't have to spend much time outside of lectures and labs studying.

reviews.author: Pete
reviews.comment_content: The content is interesting. You will learn about different ways of designing a product and the process it takes. Tends to be a very hands-on course, with a lot of labs that will help you to be a bit more creative.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Ravi is a good comunicator, but very demanding when it comes to results. The course is quite project-oriented (ard 25% of the score is for the final design project). You need to convince the professor your idea is the best one.
reviews.comment_grading: It really depends on the amount of work you do. I would suggest: be very active in class and work a lot in the design project. The exams are easy. If the professor knows you and likes your work, you will at least have a B+
reviews.comment_workload: Workload gets heavy at the end of the semester. If you love product design, you will not have any problem and have quite a bit of fun. But if you don't like it, it will be tough

reviews.author: dicky4422
reviews.comment_content:
This course includes quite a lot topics on product design, like what should you consider before determine what is your product.
Besides, there are also labs for sketching and 3D graph software
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor had taught this course for many years and very familiar with the course material
reviews.comment_grading: not easy to have high grade as there are too many catalogue, including IPRS, sketching or 3D drawing homework, midterm and final project.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is a IPRS test on every lecture( once per week) and almost one assignment every week for the first half semester. After the mid-term, you still have to spend time for the final group project, which have to present at the last lab.
You are also required to read a book, but it is not necessary.

reviews.author: balllll
reviews.comment_content: Content is interesting and some paper drawing skills were taught in the first few lessons. The following lectures will focus more on drawing with softwares and lastly the 3D drawing software rhino.
reviews.comment_teaching: TAs will appear in both lectures and lab sessions and they will answer question whenever you need help. TAs are very helpful and remind you to hand in the lab and do clear work.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. Midterm and the final projects are both decisive when it comes to your final grade. However, midterm is not difficult. Just revise the lecture notes provided in canvas and you will probably be fine.
reviews.comment_workload:
10PRS in each lecture .
have to hand in each lab on time .
around 6 lab and 1 project .
if you are interested in designing creative things ,it is a good choice for you

reviews.author: ywt
reviews.comment_content: Content is interesting and some paper drawing skills were taught in the first few lessons. The following lectures will focus more on drawing with softwares and lastly the 3D drawing software rhino.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ravi is quite nice and humorous sometimes so lectures are not as boring as expected. TAs will appear in both lectures and lab sessions and they will answer questiona whenever you need help.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. Midterm and the final projects are both decisive when it comes to your final grade. However, midterm is not difficult. Just revise the lecture notes provided in canvas and you will probably be fine.
reviews.comment_workload: There are quite a number of lab work and design product that you have to hand in. Yet, if you enjoy doing artwork or design stuff, you will enjoy it very much! Also, be prepare for the PRS session at the beginning of each lecture. There are 10 PRS questions but most of them are straight forward that answers can be directly found be lecture notes.

If you have enough talent and interest in design, you will absolutely love this course.

reviews.comment_workload:
The instructor will hold PRS sessions every lesson, and he will strictly check whether there are anyone helping others to take the PRS. The PRS questions are rather difficult, and only correct answers will be considered into attendance.
He also requires you to sketch at the first few lessons, giving rather short time for you to finish. It will be harsh when you are unable to finish the sketches, and the sketchbook is required to submit at the end of the semester.
The project depends on what you are designing, and bear in mind that you must create a product with NEW ideas, and not yet been invented by others.

reviews.author: Plasticsmile
reviews.comment_content:
Quite interesting .
You can practice different softwares for product design and also the sketching skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ravi welcomes questions. You can ask him any topics related to design and you will enjoy talking with him. Also, the TAs are quite experienced and they      are patient.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grade.
How hard-working you are, what grade you will get.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload of labs is quite heavy and you better do preparation before labs. You may not finish you lab on time if you haven't done any preparations (Marks will be deducted for late submission).
Best two of the three quizzes will be graded. The quizzes are quite easy, just a little calculation and some design concept.

reviews.author: Kostadin
reviews.title: Genuinely the worst module I have taken in my 4 years at University
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is really broad and has very little structure. You start with computer programming and graphic design and move to mechanics, 3D printing and design principles. Because there are so many topics you don't really end up learning anything in depth which is really frustrating and the value of the course becomes low.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ravi seems like a nice guy but the teaching was awful. He spent most lectures doing multiple choice questions with clickers which really delivers very little value and just tests whether you did the reading. The labs were fun at the start but very disappointing by the end because the teaching assistants themselves weren't very skilled with Rhino.
reviews.comment_grading: There were 3 quizzes and projects every fortnight or so on the labs. This was the right way to test this course but the assignments themselves were quite bad.
reviews.comment_workload: Ravi expects you to put a lot of work in but doesn't offer much in return in respect to teaching. If you want to do well you have to consistently put the work in every week to keep on top the projects as the labs aren't long enough.
